attributes.action: Cut the cost of parking within the city centre
attributes.additional_details:
I want my local government to think about the negative impact the price increases in public parking have to daily commuters. Mayflower East car park in the city centre has had a daily
Price increase of £4 and a monthly
Increase of £20, how is that justifiable when the only change to the car park is the pay machines. Other than Toys R Us car park there is no where reasonably priced and
Not forgetting somewhere that is safe to park
within in the city centre and not the outer edge
attributes.background: During the cost of living we have all noticed everything going up, gas/electric, food, petrol etc. Affordable parking is lacking and what once was affordable has had a major price hike which then takes up a significant portion of your monthly wage

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the owners and operators of parking.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
